meanings.definition: To surpass in argument or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: She outcaviled her opponent in the debate by presenting strong evidence.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outcavil others by using logical explanations.
meanings.sent3: The clever student managed to outcavil the teacher with a well-prepared argument.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcavil her classmates made her the star debater.
meanings.sent5: In the end, she outcaviled everyone with her flawless reasoning.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart through cleverness or deceit.
meanings.sent1: The detective was able to outcavil the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outcavil his friend in the game of chess but failed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to outcavil the dog by hiding in a clever spot.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to outcavil her opponents worked perfectly in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The magician outcaviled the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
